Name: Isis Aphrodite
Description: This terracotta figurine represents Isis Aphrodite seated, the legs spread apart and raised. The hair, with its curves in the form of melon parts and long curls, surrounds the face and falls down over the shoulders and back. The piece belongs to a series of identical figurines used as talismans of fertility. It symbolises the principle of regeneration of nature and more specifically the act of the goddess uniting herself with the mummified body of her husband, Osiris.
